alert.note: Alert for Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 10 at 5:53AM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues. * WHERE...A portion of Northern Maine, including the following county, Aroostook. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Some low-water crossings may be impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 548 AM EDT, Trained weather spotters and an NWS employee reported an ice jam near Donnelly Island and Donnelly Brook along the Aroostook River in Wade causing minor flooding upstream from the jam. Gardner Creek Road over Gardner Brook is flooded. - Areas near Gardner Brook and the Aroostook River upstream of the jam are the most likely places to experience minor flooding. This includes the following streams and drainages... Gardner Brook and Aroostook River. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Water levels can rise and fall quickly in the vicinity of ice jams. Those with interests along rivers and tributary streams should be alert for rapidly fluctuating water levels in the vicinity of ice jams. Never drive through flooded roads or around closed road barricades. The barricades are there for your safety due to the potential for ice jam releases or continued flooding.
